example.name: plain old transitive
example.text: The Herald kept its old-time Hearst readership.

example.name: object control with sentential attribute
example.text: Ringers keep the bells sounding in the many belfries of East Anglia.
example.arg: sounding in the many belfries of East Anglia

example.name: object control with Adj attribute
example.text: The captain kept the crew loyal.

roleset.name: maintain some prepositional relationship

example.name: be careful with 'from'!
example.text: Growers can't always keep the worm from the apple.

example.name: keep from: quasi-aspectual
example.text: Japanese demand has kept the U.S. currency from *trace* plunging.

example.name: keep out
example.text: Britain kept light tanks out of the talks.

example.name: keep off
example.text: Keep your Foster Savings Institution off the federal budget deficit.

example.name: with attributive
example.text: The Fed kept inflation-fighting as its top priority.

roleset.note: This roleset shows some relationship between nouns or gerundsdescribed by the preposition introducing the second noun, and the'keep' is causing or maintaining that relationship.

roleset.name: prepositional, comforming (ONLY ANNOTATED BY AMR)

roles.note: This should ONLY be annotated for AMR!!! not PropBank.

example.name: keep with
example.text: ... in *trace=nothing* keeping with the reputation of the company.
example.arg: with the reputation of the company.

example.name: Both args
example.text: There will be no flowers at the funeral, in keeping with the family's wishes.
example.arg: There will be no flowers at the funeral

roleset.note: PropBankers: DO NOT ANNOTATE THIS SENSE, AMR: ANNOTATE THIS SENSE!

roleset.name: keep up: maintain one's position

example.name: keeping up with the Joneses
example.text: John can't keep up with Mary's rapid mood swings.

roleset.note: There is a VN class for this VPC, but it's not relevant.

roleset.name: sustain

roles.note: this sense is transitive, vs. the other 'keep_up', which is intransitive. In this sense, the state of arg1 is what is being maintained, and in the other sense, arg0's state is being maintained.

example.name: maintaining physical entity's good condition
example.text: He did not like to think of all the time and rags and polishes he-1 had spent on *-1 keeping the house up .

roleset.note: Member of Vncls 55.6. Comparison to keep.01. Added by Julia based on examples in Brown.

example.name: aspectual
example.text: State monopolies will keep on [*-1] stifling trade, ``free'' prices or not, until something else replaces them.

frameset.note: Framed and reframed and reframed again on basis of much discussionabout aspectual usages. Ugh.
